result.name: children_in_out-of-work_benefit_households
result.notes:
Experimental statistics on children in out-of-work benefit households. These figures show the numbers of children living in households where at least one parent or guardian claimed one or more of the following out-of-work benefits: Job Seekers.

https://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http://research.dwp.gov.uk/asd/asd1/ben_hholds/child_ben_hholds.asp

From January 2010 these will be released as part of the DWP Statistical Summary.
https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/children-in-out-of-work-benefit-households--2

Source: Department for Work and Pensions (DWP)

Publisher: Department for Work and Pensions (DWP)

Geographies: Local Authority District (LAD), Government Office Region (GOR), National, Parliamentary Constituency

Geographic coverage: Great Britain

Time coverage: 2008 to 2010

Type of data: Administrative data

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions

result.title: Children in 'Out-of-work Benefit' households
